What is the purpose of the "nullifiers" field in the JSON object?
The "nullifiers" field in the JSON object is a JSON array of strings, where each string is a hexadecimal representation of an input note nullifier.
How do you decode the ciphertexts in the "ciphertexts" field using the "onetimePubKey"?
The "onetimePubKey" is not used to decode the ciphertexts. It is actually used to encrypt the ciphertexts. The decryption process is not specified.

The "randomSeed" field is not used to generate the proof. The "proof" field in the JSON object contains a hexadecimal representation of a zero-knowledge proof, which is a separate entity from the "randomSeed".
